title: Sweet-and-Sour Carrots
introduction: Sweet-and-Sour Carrots are a delightful side dish that pairs seamlessly with roast pork or chicken. The addition of a touch of parsley, mint, or basil enhances the freshness, making it a perfect accompaniment for any meal.
instructions: Peel the carrots. Cut them into 1/4-inch-thick slices.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the vinegar and sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in the carrots and salt to taste. Cover the pot and cook until the carrots are softened, about 5 minutes.
Uncover the pan and cook the carrots, stirring frequently, until tender, about 5 minutes more. Taste for seasoning. Serve hot or at room temperature.
